intro: Alaticaulia zumbae, commonly known as the Zumbá tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The tree is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
